intro: Pseudognaphalium inornatum, commonly known as the slender everlasting flower, is a herbaceous plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous tiny florets. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, which bloom in late summer to early autumn. It has a compact growth habit with hairy, linear leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Pseudognaphalium inornatum is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils, making it a hardy addition to xeriscaped gardens.
